Content:
Config.sys

DOS=HIGH,UMB

DEVICE=c:\windows\himem.sys
rem DEVICE=c:\windows\emm386.exe 4096 RAM D=256 I=B000-B7FF

rem for ProMovie Driver
DEVICE=c:\windows\emm386.exe 4096 RAM D=256 I=B000-B7FF noems x=DD00-DDFF


FILES=30
BUFFERS=10
STACKS=9,128
LASTDRIVE=F

rem Creative Labs DOS Compatibility Mode PNP Configuration Manager
DEVICE=c:\util\awe32dos\ctcm.exe

rem Creative Labs CD-ROM DOS Mode Driver
DEVICEHIGH=C:\PROGRA~1\SBCD\DOSDRV\SBIDE.SYS /D:MSCD001 /V /P:168,10,36e

rem DriveSpace Driver (things get weird if these lines are not last!)
DEVICEHIGH=C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND\DRVSPACE.SYS /MOVE


----------------


SET PATH=C:\QTW\BIN;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND;C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND\CDROM;C:\UTIL;C:\KMOUSE

rem ON prevents writing to bad sectors...
VERIFY ON
prompt $p$g

rem Kensington Mouse Controls
C:\KMOUSE\MOUSE -LC:\KMOUSE\VCI.OVL -TCPN
C:\KMOUSE\CONTROL

rem Windows 95 MSCDEX
C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND\MSCDEX /D:MSCD001 /V /M:8

rem Sound Blaster AWE32 DOS Compatibility Mode
SET MIDI=SYNTH:1 MAP:E MODE:0
SET BLASTER=A220 I5 D1 H5 P330 E640 T6 


***

rem device=c:\windows\himem.sys

rem X-Wing emm386:
rem device=c:\windows\emm386.exe 4096 RAM D=256

rem ProMovie emm386:
rem device=c:\windows\emm386.exe 4096 RAM D=256 noems x=DD00-DDFF

rem DEVICEHIGH=C:\WINDOWS\SETVER.EXE
